intro: Hypolytrum parvibracteum, commonly known as the narrow-bracted grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically at the base of the leaf sheaths. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. Hypolytrum parvibracteum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small invertebrates.
